page.title: 15Crook Peak
page.content: The actual summit of {Crook Peak {is}just to the south of the area, but the vast majority of the top of this Mendip hill comes within our area. Crook Peak itself is in Somerset, but Barton Hill, just to the north is in Avon. The National Trust are intending to buy the land stretching from{Crook {Peak}to Shute Shelve in the east. Most people think that Crook Peak is the highest Mendip Hill, but this honour goes to Blackdown.{Crook Peak}is the most significant landmark, however, being very familiar to travellers to and from the West Country, because it is so close to the M5. The deal has been agreed, but the trust is to launch a Â£69,000 appeal to help pay for it.
